subject: Photography
title: Lens Distortion Explained
description: A micro-lesson that makes Lens Distortion Explained usable.

hook.text: Ever noticed straight lines bowing outward in a wide-angle photo? That's lens distortion playing tricks.

buildup.text: No lens is optically perfect. Barrel distortion bows lines outward; pincushion distortion pinches them inward.

discovery.text: Wide-angle lenses suffer barrel distortion most. Telephoto lenses tend toward pincushion distortion.

twist.text: Modern software corrects distortion automatically using lens profiles. Your 'straight' photo was probably curved first.

climax.text: Distortion is physics, not failure. Every lens bends reality ‚Äî software just bends it back.

punchline.text: Your lens lies. Your software corrects the lie.
